title: Support tickets?

embed.description: Imgur: The magic of the Internet

body:
I am not naming and shaming. Because the players name is blacked out.
My Question is this.. Does support ticket about this really work. All I get when I do is the basic reply of 

" Thank you for this report! I am really sorry for the bad experience this player has created for you.

We can’t often take action on reports sent to us through tickets and we usually do not take responsibility for conflicts that happen in the private chat/pre-game lobby/post game lobby, but rest assured, we will investigate further this player's behavior. I am sorry, but due to privacy reasons I will not be able to disclose any information regarding the conclusion of our investigation.

Also, please make sure to use our report feature each time you encounter a player that is negatively impacting your game. Each report brings violators of the Summoner's Code one step closer to punishment and, hopefully, toward reformed behavior.

You’ll occasionally, but not always, get messages from the IFS letting you know that a player you reported has been punished. Keep reporting inappropriate behavior and we’ll make sure negative actions have consequences! "

I understand Riot has templates that are approved because they have to be " Professionals " about it. but sometimes I wish I would get a reply of " Damn dude. We are getting on to that. Pace out brah "

replies.body:
I tried playing a game of Nasus Jungle with Dark Harvest in a normal game the other day, it was in normals because I was trying something wacky for fun. But what happened in the game just made me quit and go play something else. My toplaner would do absolutely nothing when I tried to gank and I just ended up 1v1ing the enemy laner until I couldn't beat him so I ran away. I was met with question pings and my toplaner just flaming me in chat. By the end of the game it didn't go so well for me and my whole team was going off at me. My adc calls me "autistic", the support thresh calls me and idiot and a troll and other stupid stuff. Then I get into the post game lobby and I call them out on being toxic and bullies and the enemy team decides to agree with them saying "Who wouldn't report a Nasus jungle, what a troll". My team sees this as a chance to continue flaming me and I just end up reporting them all. Of course I know nothing is going to be done against these people so I make an effort to send in a support ticket with all their names visible and the stuff they said in post-game lobby.

Still haven't gotten a response yet, Riot's probably gonna skim over it and use their good ol' CTRL + V
Autistic isn't on the list, so i guess they are safe.

I've played since season 2, and only once have I ever had the message "a player has been punished due to your report" or whatever it is.

I never report out of spite, only for legit reasons.

I know that until a bit over a year ago they were way more dodgy than they are now. It's also possible they don't appear in ARAMs? I don't really trust the notification at all to be honest it's so freaking janky, though I do get them every now and again.

Yeah i wish they'd just turn up how many people see it (like every report in the last 3-4 games) then we would have less issues.

That said, from my tracking of people i report, a lot fewer get anything that big then i'd like.

Believe me I know. To me that notification is real important, and shouldn't just feel like a side note priority wise. Feedback that reports actually do something is what gets players to report, which catches more negative behaviour. The number of people that say "I don't bother to report" just because there's no explicit feedback is frustrating, and fixing and expanding that notification would alleviate a lot of that.

I also think investing in a warning notification when you've been validly reported (but not enough for punishment) is worthwhile for those minor cases of toxicity that escalate over time, and while I think a chat restriction is a worthy warning, I think there needs to be something that shows when they *start* to cross the line, not when they actually cross it. Maybe another tier of chat restriction that has lesser restrictions and doesn't affect your honour/rewards given that players and popups don't mix.

I dont want some people to be perma ban. I just want them to know this is not called for.
Chat ban really has made me less " Tilted " so to me. It should be the same in return.

>I dont want some people to be perma ban. I just want them to know this is not called for.
Chat ban really has made me less " Tilted " so to me. It should be the same in return.

I get where your coming from (as one of the people that advocate that the 14 day ban escalations are too much) but unfortunately, we have to take the bans we are given from Riot.

If someone says an auto ban word, just report them and they are going to get a 14 day ban (and not very likely) potentially not being as flame heavy.

Otherwise, Chat bans are impossible to know about, unless you directly add and ask the person you reported (i don't recommend doing this)

Beyond what's been said already, it pretty much comes down to a privacy thing. Support won't ever give you any info about someone else's account. It's great to know when you're contributing, but in the name of ideally encouraging reform, opening the door for people to shame or abuse players for being punished isn't the way to go.

Every now and then, I'm about to report someone as a bot... then I see that they are lvl 12, and somehow in a game with golds and plats.
This is on the players that queue with their noob friends.

I mean, while they always do that, you can generally tell if someone has been banned off it if you decide to keep an eye on their account.

That said, abuse generally has to hit the key no-no words to get banned (mostly only the worst sort of Racist/homophobic words)

Someone saying kill yourselves, isn't as easily picked up by the bot, because the bot can't pick up context between "go kill yourself" and "you kill(ed) yourself"

But yeah easiest way to track if someone is banned is if they are still playing games, they aren't banned.
